content.description: Squat down and start with hands on big incut jug, work out right to the perfect pinch feature, and then up the arete for the blind throw to the pocket around left.
content.location: The first or second boulder you’ll come across when following the river down stream.

content.description: Sit start a good left sidepull and a decent flat right hand immediately adjacent. Traverse right through shouldery slopers and crimps to a slopping dish towards the far right of the face. Stem across the dihedral and top out the easy face perpendicular to the climb.
content.location: Facing the graffitied boulder with Hawthorn and Daytura Daydream, look right and walk past Solely Slopers and Slobber. Start is on the right side of the arete--other face of the arete that Slobber starts on--and traverses the face right.

content.description: Start on sloper rail and adjacent crimp to the left, work your way up the refrigerator squeeze block.
content.location: Same boulder/same face as Hawthorn, slightly left of the Hawthorn start.

content.description: Start hands on undercling crimp rail, go up, topout sucks
Start with feet on slab and super low underclings move up using only the slopers and neither of the cracks on the sides.
content.location: The obvious refrigerator bloc to the right of Hawthorn.

climbs.name: One lowball to rule them all

content.description: Start low and left with hands on the bottom of the rail, heel and toe trickery further down left. Work your way up the rail without using the lip of the boulder, finish on top of the big horn out right.
content.location: Adjacent to the Hawthorn boulder, parallel to the river

content.description: Start on the rightmost part of the rail with a left sidepull. Small feet and a long reach will get you to the good gaston crimp. Hold on through the slopey topout. All crimps to the right of the starting hold are off
content.protection: A pad or two. Cover the rock that sticks out a bit on the topout

content.description: Sit start left and low on the sloper rail, hands as far in on the rail as possible, feet start further down left. Work your way across the rail and then into the crimps up the face along the right side of the boulder.
content.location: Keep hugging the river bed from the parking lot until you arrive at a spray painted boulder with a slightly overhanging face. That is the Hawthorn boulder.

content.description: Committing combined with tiny crimps. Start on the jug at chest height and climb through small edges and a final jump to the dirty lip. The left arete is off
content.protection: Pads. The landing is super slanted so thats how it gets the R rating. Practice the moves on a rope beforehand
content.location: This is the boulder up the hill about 100 feet from the trail. The boulder is about 200-300 feet before the boulder with hawthorn and daytura daydreams

content.description: Starts the same as Hawthorn but you go straight up. Crimps to the left of the flat sidepulls are off. Crux move is getting the 1/3rd pad pinch and possibly moving off it to the lip.
content.location: Follow river down from parking to the same boulder as “Hawthorn” and “Squishy”
